question:
Attorney General as the Principal Law Officer of the Government of India:
  1. tenders advice to the President of India on all important legal matters.
  2. attends meetings of the Parliament on important issues.
  3. votes in the Lok Sabha on important legal matters.
  4. represents the government in the courts on very important legal matters
Which of the above is / are correct?
explanation: Attorney General can participate in the parliamentary proceedings but can not vote.
